title: RelMix 1.3
text: Start RelMix typing following command R console open user interface seen Figure 1. Figure 1: RelMix main window.
code: relMixGUI()

title: RelMix 1.3
text: example consider paternity case mixed DNA profile mother child, addition reference profiles mother alleged father.

previous_headings: Example 1: A paternity case
title: RelMix 1.3
text: first step RelMix import data. import files must either comma, semicolon tab-separated must dots decimal separators. Examples given three types files needed: mixture profile, reference profiles allele frequencies. mixture profile reference profiles contain loci order, allele frequency file can contain additional loci profiles. RelMix give error message data file error fatal program. RelMix return warning minor error data file fatal program.

previous_headings: Example 1: A paternity case > 1. Import data
title: RelMix 1.3
text: Table 1 shows structure mixture file. first line contain column names shown : ‘SampleName’, ‘Marker’, ‘Allele1’ etc. mixture profile example maximum three unique alleles per markers, file may expanded columns ‘Allele4’, ‘Allele5’ additional observed alleles. example 22 markers, first five shown . autosomal markers can included. Marker names case sensitive, error message given markers found database. Table 1: mixture profile example 1. multiple replicates, next replicate profile must different sample name (e.g. “relMix2”) follow directly first replicate (.e. blank lines ).

previous_headings: Example 1: A paternity case > 1. Import data
title: RelMix 1.3
text: Table 2 shows format file containing reference profiles (reference profiles file). first line correspond column names seen . different reference profiles follow directly , profile specific sample name. example two reference profiles, “Mother” “Father”. file shoud contain profiles individuals defined pedigree. Note: long built-pedigrees used, reference profiles named either “Father”, “Mother” “Child” individual IDs defined pedigrees. custom pedigrees provided, sample name can used (see example 2 ). first two markers last one shown profile. Table 2: Reference profiles mother alleged father example 1.

previous_headings: Example 1: A paternity case > 1. Import data
title: RelMix 1.3
text: Figure 2: Database window. clicking database button main interface, window Figure 2 appears. Table 3 shows format allele frequencies imported . one row per allele one column per marker. blank space indicates allele observed marker. excerpt database shown . Table 3: Excerpt allele frequency database example 1. Dots used decimal separator. Figure 3: Database options. Theta value, silent allele frequency minimum allele frequency. clicking ‘Save’ return window Figure 2, need click ‘ok’ exit database settings. previously unobserved allele (.e. database) found imported profiles, notification given alllele added database minimum allele frequency. allele frequencies sum 1, question appear whether like scale frequencies. , rest allele added.

previous_headings: Example 2: Mutations, silent alleles and custom pedigree > 1. Import data
title: RelMix 1.3
text: allele frequencies one diallelic marker given Table 6. Table 6: Allele frequencies. Figure 8: Database options example 2. Figure 9: Scale frequencies add rest allele. Note 1: rest allele can addded sum frequencies less 1. Therefore, enforced scaling performed click “” sum larger 1. Note 2: added rest allele given name “r”. stepwise mutation model chosen (see section ), numeric allele names required, case scaling must chosen.

previous_headings: Example 2: Mutations, silent alleles and custom pedigree
title: RelMix 1.3
text: Clicking mutation button main interface opens new window. default mutations accounted (mutation rate set 0). three mutation models choose . ‘Equal’ mutation model assumes mutations equally likely, ‘Proportional’ model assumes mutation rates proportional allele frequencies, ‘Stepwise’ mutation model assumes mutations closer allelles (fewer sequence repeats difference) probable. ‘Stepwise’ chosen, range must also specified indicates relative probability mutating n+1 steps versus mutating n steps. mutation model requires allele names numerics indicating number sequence repeats. account microinvariants, treat mutations microinvariants practically impossible. option corresponds model ‘Stepwise (unstationary)’ Familias 3. Mutations silent alleles possible models. See Familias manual details mutation models (https://familias./). Figure 10: Mutations example 2.

previous_headings: Example 2: Mutations, silent alleles and custom pedigree
title: RelMix 1.3
text: Since hypotheses example covered built-pedigrees, provide RelMix custom pedigrees defined R scripts. R scripts can instance exported Familias 3, can also generated manually. script shows code needed provide first pedigree two contributors mother child. second pedigree, two contributors unrelated, defined . Note 1: pedigree must defined variable called “ped1”. Note 2: names individuals pedigree (id) must correspond names individuals reference profiles. Note 3: pedigree must defined separate R script. Figure 11: import custom pedigrees R scripts example 2.
code: persons <- c("C2","C1") ped1 <- FamiliasPedigree(id=persons, dadid=c(NA,NA), momid=c("C1", NA),                           sex=c("male", "female")) persons <- c("C2","C1") ped1 <- FamiliasPedigree(id=c(persons), dadid=c(NA, NA),                           momid=c( NA, NA), sex=c("male", "female"))

previous_headings: Example 2: Mutations, silent alleles and custom pedigree

text: Figure 12: Tick individuals contributors mixture pedigrees.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Guro Dorum. Author, maintainer. Elias Hernandis. Author. Navreet Kaur. Contributor. Thore Egeland. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dorum G, Hernandis E (2023). relMix: Relationship Inference DNA Mixtures. R package version 1.3.5, https://gdorum.github.io/relMix/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {relMix: Relationship Inference for DNA Mixtures},   author = {Guro Dorum and Elias Hernandis},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.3.5},   url = {https://gdorum.github.io/relMix/}, }

title: Relationship Inference for DNA Mixtures
text: relMix makes relationship inference involving DNA mixtures unknown profiles interprets DNA mixtures related contributors. main function graphical user interface relMixGUI.

title: Relationship Inference for DNA Mixtures
text: Install GitHub follows: encounter problems, please follow installation instructions found : https://www.familias.name/openfamilias.html. provide pedigree plots, relMix uses package tkrplot. However, package compatibility issues MacOS hence included hard dependency. Users wish see pedigree plots results screen install package tkrplot manually tkrplot package loaded relMix automatially, users need run library("tkrplot") advance.
code: # First install devtools if needed if(!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("gdorum/relMix",build_vignettes = TRUE) install.packages("tkrplot")

what: Load and check a frequency file — checkFrequenciesFile

text: Loads frequency database file compares mixture data check common errors.

code: checkFrequenciesFile(filename, mix)

title: Load and check a frequency file — checkFrequenciesFile
text: filename Path frecuency database file mix Data frame mixture data. See relMix vignette description format

title: Load and check a frequency file — checkFrequenciesFile
text: list containing df Data frame frequencies warning List strings describing errors ocurred fixed prevent execution program. error List strings describing errors ocurred made imposible return valid data frame. list empty, dataframe item NULL

title: Load and check a frequency file — checkFrequenciesFile
text: mixture data used perform advanced checks, make sure alleles present mixture file entry frequency database. warnings found, function attempts fix explains done warning messages. error found, checking stops NULL dataframe returned. error described error messages.

title: Load and check a frequency file — checkFrequenciesFile
text: Elias Hernandis

title: Load and check a frequency file — checkFrequenciesFile
code: if (FALSE) { mixfile <- system.file("extdata","mixture.txt",package="relMix") mix <- checkMixtureFile(mixfile) # note: the mixture dataframe is passed as an argument # if the previous check failed, the program should not continue # with the frequencies file check freqfile <- system.file('extdata','frequencies22Markers.txt',package='relMix') freqs <- checkFrequenciesFile(freqfile, mix$df) }

title: Load and check a mixture file — checkMixtureFile
code: if (FALSE) { mixfile <- system.file("extdata","mixture.txt",package="relMix") result <- checkMixtureFile(mixfile); print(result$df); print(result$warning); print(result$error); }

title: Check a pedigree file — checkPedigreeFile
text: pedigree file must .R file defining pedigree (see relMix vignette example). data frame reference data used compare names individuals detect possible misspellings. warnings found, function attempts fix explains done warning messages. error found, checking stops. error described error messages.

title: Check a pedigree file — checkPedigreeFile
text: Elias Hernandis

title: Check a pedigree file — checkPedigreeFile
code: if (FALSE) { #First load mixture file mixfile <- system.file("extdata","mixture_silent_ex.txt",package="relMix") mix <- checkMixtureFile(mixfile); #Load reference file reffile <- system.file("extdata","references_silent.txt",package="relMix") ref <- checkReferenceFile(reffile, mix$df) #Check pedigree file pedfile <- system.file("extdata","custom_pedigree_maternity_duo.R",package="relMix") checkPedigreeFile(pedfile,ref$df); }

what: Check a reference profiles file — checkReferenceFile

text: Given reference profile file name function attempts load compare mixture file detect possible errors.

code: checkReferenceFile(filename, mix)

title: Check a reference profiles file — checkReferenceFile
text: filename Path reference profiles file mix Data frame mixture data

title: Check a reference profiles file — checkReferenceFile
text: list containing df loaded data frame, NULL errors present warning list strings describing errors ocurred fixed prevent execution program. error list strings describing errors ocurred made impossible return valid data frame. list empty, data frame item null.

title: Check a reference profiles file — checkReferenceFile
text: See relMix vignette description format reference file. data frame mixture data used compare warnings found, function attempts fix explains done warning messages. error found, checking stops NULL dataframe returned. error described error messages.

title: Check a reference profiles file — checkReferenceFile
text: Elias Hernandis

title: Check a reference profiles file — checkReferenceFile
code: if (FALSE) { #Load a mixture file mixfile <- system.file("extdata","mixture.txt",package="relMix") mix <- checkMixtureFile(mixfile); #Note: the mixture dataframe is passed as an argument. If the previous check failed, #the program should not continue with the reference file check reffile <- system.file("extdata","references.txt",package="relMix") checkReferenceFile(reffile, mix$df); }

what: Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
title: Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
text: data matrix genotypes known individuals possible genotypes unknown individuals created.

title: Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
code: createDatamatrix(locus, knownGenos, idsU = NULL)

title: Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
text: locus Familias locus containing information alleles knownGenos List known genotypes. element vector genotype one individual. elements must named idsU Vector indices unknown individuals

title: Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
text: data matrix genotypes row corresponds individual.

title: Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
text: Guro Dorum

title: Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
code: #Define alleles and frequencies alleles <- 1:2 afreq <- c(0.5,0.5) #Create locus object locus <- Familias::FamiliasLocus(frequencies=afreq,name="M1",allelenames= alleles) #Known genotypes of alleged father and mother, child's genotype is uknown gAF <- c(1,1) gMO <- c(1,1) datamatrix <- createDatamatrix(locus,knownGenos=list(AF=gAF,MO=gMO),idsU=c("CH"))

what: Create a mixture of genotypes with simulated drop-in and dropout — generateMix
title: Create a mixture of genotypes with simulated drop-in and dropout — generateMix
text: Takes input genotypes creates mixture. Alleles drop mixture specified probabilities

title: Create a mixture of genotypes with simulated drop-in and dropout — generateMix
code: generateMix(G, alleles, afreq, D, di)

title: Create a mixture of genotypes with simulated drop-in and dropout — generateMix
text: G List genotypes. element vector genotype one individual alleles Numeric character Vector allele names marker afreq Numeric vector allele frequencies marker D List dropout values (0 1) per contributor. element vector containing heterozygous homozygous dropout probability given contributor di Drop-value (0 1)

title: Create a mixture of genotypes with simulated drop-in and dropout — generateMix
text: vector mixture alleles.

title: Create a mixture of genotypes with simulated drop-in and dropout — generateMix
text: Guro Dorum

title: Create a mixture of genotypes with simulated drop-in and dropout — generateMix
code: #Define alleles and frequencies alleles <- 1:2 afreq <- c(0.5,0.5) #Genotypes gM <- c(1,1) gC <- c(1,2) #Dropout and drop-in values d <- 0.1 di <- 0.05 #No drop-in for first contributor D <- list(c(0,0),c(d,d^2)) R <- generateMix(G=list(gM,gC),alleles,afreq,D=D,di=di)

what: Likelihoods for DNA mixtures with dropout and dropin — mixLikDrop
title: Likelihoods for DNA mixtures with dropout and dropin — mixLikDrop
text: Computes likelihood mixture conditioned given number known unknown contributors, drop-dropout probabilities.

title: Likelihoods for DNA mixtures with dropout and dropin — mixLikDrop
code: mixLikDrop(R, G, D, di = 0, alleleNames, afreq)

title: Likelihoods for DNA mixtures with dropout and dropin — mixLikDrop
text: R Vector mixture alleles G List genotypes. element vector genotype one individual D List dropout values (0 1) per contributor. element vector containing heterozygous homozygous dropout probability given contributor di Drop-value (0 1) alleleNames Vector allele names marker afreq Vector allele frequencies marker

title: Likelihoods for DNA mixtures with dropout and dropin — mixLikDrop
text: likelihood

title: Likelihoods for DNA mixtures with dropout and dropin — mixLikDrop
text: model specified appendix Haned et al. (2012) Exploratory data analysis interpretation low template DNA mixtures, FSI Genetics Dec;6(6):762-74

title: Likelihoods for DNA mixtures with dropout and dropin — mixLikDrop
text: Guro Dorum

title: Likelihoods for DNA mixtures with dropout and dropin — mixLikDrop
code: #Define alleles and frequencies alleles <- 1:2 afreq <- c(0.5,0.5) #Genotypes gM <- c(1,1) gC <- c(1,2) #Mixture alleles R <- c(1,2) #Dropout and drop-in values d <- 0.1 di <- 0.05 #No drop-in for first contributor D <- list(c(0,0),c(d,d^2)) mixLikDrop(R=R,G=list(gM,gC),D=D,di=di,alleleNames=alleles,afreq=afreq) #> [1] 0.9025

what: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: Calculates likelihoods relationship inference involving mixtures missing reference profiles, including drop-dropout, mutations, silent alleles theta correction.

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
code: relMix(   pedigrees,   locus,   R,   datamatrix,   ids,   D = rep(list(c(0, 0)), length(ids)),   di = 0,   kinship = 0 )

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: pedigrees list pedigrees defined using FamiliasPedigree Familias locus Familias locus. Note silent allele must indicated 's' ('silent' Familias) R vector mixture alleles, list multiple replicates datamatrix line corresponds one constellation genotypes involved individuals. Indices individuals must given rownames must correspond indices pedigree ids Index vector indicating individuals contributors mixture. indices must correspond indices pedigree D List dropout values (0 1) per contributor. element vector containing heterozygous homozygous dropout probability given contributor di Drop-value (0 1) kinship Defines theta-parameter

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: likelihoods pedigrees detailed output term considered calculation.

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: function requires package Familias calls function FamiliasPedigree.

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: Dorum et al. (2017) Pedigree-based relationship inference complex DNA mixtures, Int J Legal Med., doi:10.1007/s00414-016-1526-x;  Kaur et al. (2016) Relationship inference based DNA mixtures, Int J Legal Med.;130(2):323-9;  Egeland, Kling, Mostad (2015) Familias

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: Navreet Kaur, Thore Egeland, Guro Dorum

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
code: #Example 1: paternity trio with mixture of mother and child #Define alleles and frequencies alleles <- 1:2 afreq <- c(0.4,0.6) #Define pedigrees persons <- c("CH","MO","AF") ped1 <- Familias::FamiliasPedigree(id=persons, dadid=c("AF",NA, NA), momid=c("MO", NA,NA),                         sex=c("male", "female", "male")) ped2 <- Familias::FamiliasPedigree(id=c(persons, "TF"), dadid=c("TF", NA, NA,NA),                         momid=c("MO", NA, NA,NA), sex=c("male", "female", "male", "male")) pedigrees <- list(isFather = ped1, unrelated=ped2) #Create locus object locus <- Familias::FamiliasLocus(frequencies=afreq,name="M1",                       allelenames= alleles) #Known genotypes of alleged father and mother gAF <- c(1,1) gMO <- c(1,1) #Mixture alleles R <- c(1,2) datamatrix <- createDatamatrix(locus,knownGenos=list(AF=gAF,MO=gMO),idsU=c("CH")) #Define dropout and drop-in values d <- 0.1 di <- 0.05 res <- relMix(pedigrees, locus, R, datamatrix, ids=c("MO","CH"),              D=list(c(0,0),c(d,d^2)),di=di, kinship=0) #LR=0.054 res$isFather/res$unrelated #> [1] 0.05417118  #Example 2: Exhaustive example with silent allele, mutations, dropout and drop-in #H1: Contributors are mother and child #H2: Contributors are mother and unrelated #Possible dropout in both contributors gMO <- c(1,1) #Mother's genotype R <- 1 #Mixture alleles #Mother/child pedigree persons <- c("CH","MO") ped1 <- Familias::FamiliasPedigree(id=persons, dadid=c(NA,NA), momid=c("MO", NA),                         sex=c("male", "female")) ped2 <- Familias::FamiliasPedigree(id=c(persons), dadid=c(NA, NA),                         momid=c( NA, NA),                         sex=c("male", "female")) pedigrees <- list(H1 = ped1, H2=ped2) #Alleles and frequencies: #When silent alleles are involved, a custom mutation matrix is required. #No mutations are possible to or from silent alleles. #We create the mutation model with FamiliasLocus and modify it before it is #passed on to relMix alleles <- c(1,2,'silent') afreq <- c(0.4,0.5,0.1) #Create initial locus object with mutation matrix locus <- Familias::FamiliasLocus(frequencies=afreq,name='M1',                       allelenames= alleles, MutationModel='Equal',                       femaleMutationRate=0.1,maleMutationRate=0.1) #Modify mutation matrix from Familias: #Silent allele must be given as 's' (not 'silent' as in Familias) newAlleles <- c(alleles[-length(alleles)],'s') mm <- locus$femaleMutationMatrix colnames(mm) <- rownames(mm) <- newAlleles #Create new locus object with modified mutation matrix locus <- Familias::FamiliasLocus(frequencies=afreq,name='M1',                       allelenames= newAlleles, MutationModel='Custom', MutationMatrix=mm) knownGenos <- list(gMO) names(knownGenos) <- c("MO") datamatrix <- createDatamatrix(locus,knownGenos,ids="CH") d <- 0.1 #Dropout probability for both contributors di <- 0.05 res2 <- relMix(pedigrees, locus, R, datamatrix, ids=c("MO","CH"),               D=list(c(d,d^2),c(d,d^2)),di=di, kinship=0) #LR=1.68 res2$H1/res2$H2 #> [1] 1.677973

title: relMix 1.3

Avoid saving loaded profiles error occurs f_importprof. Fix issue allele repeated mixture file, present database file, get added twice causing error Familias called.
